fields.description:
Hi,
we're getting an error on the Gadget "Filter results", while the filter itself works properly

{{assignee = currentUser() AND Status not in (Closed, Done, "To Deploy") ORDER BY priority}}

However once I place this filter via a gadget on a dashboard I get the following error.

This filter is shared and only one user is getting that issue. I thought it may be related to his specific role, but colleagues of him having the same rules don't experience that. I decided to report it as the filter itself works. I even did a copy of this filter and altered / simplified it, but with no success. We can live with it as the filter shows the results at the bottom, but it's kinda annoying.

Many thanks!
Jarda

{quote}

fields.summary: Error on Filter gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47191].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
All items in the column on Wallboard View will be cycled through every a few seconds (if there are too many) and there is no any option to configure this. It would be great to have this option so that users can set how many seconds the items will be cycled.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Provide an option to configure cycle period for items in the column on Wallboard View.
fields.summary: Option to configure cycle period for items in the column on Wallboard View

fields.description:
Please give us access to ticket, as requested by our Jira partner (Techtime).
JRA-46927

This is a security leak we need to be solved for our production.
With this leak anyone connected to our jira can type ahead and get even the Email address of all our customers, just by typing the company name.
fields.summary: Username and Group name enumeration (leak) in JIRA Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47188].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, It is not explicitly mentioned that Group has to be created on AD side to get synchronized to JIRA. Some users might have the understanding that synchronizing JIRA and LDAP directory will include synchronizing local groups (created in JIRA) to LDAP directory.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to mention this in the documentation that groups are to be created in LDAP to get synchronized to JIRA, while local groups (created in JIRA) will not be synchronized to LDAP.
fields.summary: Update LDAP documentation on LDAP and JIRA synchronization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47187].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The customer wanted to Customize the Issue View Layout. By Default all the custom fields will be added directly below each other and all of these will be wrapped inside the detail section with left-aligned. The customer want the custom field to be right-aligned in too and also able to move certain custom fields from left to right when needed.

How to replicate the problem :
Screenshot: 
!test.PNG|thumbnail! 
# Log in to JIRA
# Add few numbers of custom fields(Text Field-Single Line) at Administration>Issues>Custom Fields (eg: text1,text2,test3,test4)
# Associate the fields with the default screen used for the Jira Issue.
# Open any one of the Issue
# Add all the added custom fields in step 2 to the Issue Page by clicking Admin>Add Field
# Try to move the few of the custom fields added in the the left side to the right side. 
Eg :  (eg: Move test3,test4 from left side by default to the right side)



h3. Suggested Solution
When adding the custom field in the Issue Page , the customer should be able to move the custom field to be right-aligned.
The customer also should be able to move certain custom fields from the left to the right when needed.
fields.summary: Customize the Issue View Layout to add Custom Field with right-aligned
Create a picklist on Contact

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47182].
  {panel}

I'm trying to add a new gadget from confluence to a Jira Dashboard. Based on the documentation available, I should be able to do this but I need to contact Atlassian. Can you please advice? The new gadget I need are the following: 

https://dsgemm.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets:confluence-page-gadget/gadgets/confluence-page-gadget.xml

https://dsgemm.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets:confluence-page-gadget/gadgets/confluence-page-gadget.xml

In Atlassian OnDemand products, it is not possible for administrators to add gadgets to the directory. If you would like to add an Atlassian gadget to a directory, please contact Atlassian Support.

We're running JIRA v7.0.0-OD-08-001
fields.summary: Unable to add a new gadget to a dashboard using OnDemand product
Issue collector doesn't work inside of an iframe
need external IP address

I created the branch through JIRA which should have automatically have created a branch for the bamboo project but it did not. There was a broken branch link saying "TS-NID0 Failed to load"

I created a manual plan branch and it works correctly

What went wrong and what do we need to change to make things work?

Add ability for individual users (or groups) to default issue type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47175].
  {panel}

Hello,

(note , using JIRA v 6.4.10)
With the current iteration of JIRA the old issue based project overview is quite hard to find

{quote}
The old Project Summary overview can still be accessed with the new Project view:

    go to "Summary" (top link in the Project navigation bar: the project avatar)
    click on "Activity" -> change it to "Statistics"
{quote}

I have had a lot of questions about this from our users, and apparently we are not the only ones :

* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/23758217/answers/32524295?flashId=-1420565710
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/15701804/answers/32524268?flashId=1115121407

Access to this page should be easier to find and/or it should be possible to mark this page as the default landing page for a project ( related issue : https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42283)

thanks and best regards,
Loïc
fields.summary: Easier access to the issue based Project overview in the new Project Centric Navigation

fields.description:
In the Status area you can see the number of workflows a status is assigned to. If you click on this number, all assigned workflows are shown with name. Sometimes it happens, that the number doesn't match with the names. 
In the workflow column it says: 23 associated workflows but if you count the names of the workflows in the popup you maybe count 26 or something. It could be possible, that the column counts active workflows and the popup shows all workflows including inactive.
fields.summary: Wrong quantity of workflows in status area
Provide more Verbose Logging with Mail Issue that is caused due to the Application Access

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47172].
  {panel}

Since the move to new project types in JIRA 7.0, it's not possible anymore to create projects using JIRA's classic default workflow and issue type schemes.

The classic workflows are still present with no assigned project in a clean installation.

h4. Workaround
If you currently have projects created using the "Classic Project" template, new projects can be created using a shared configuration in JIRA 7.0. This will use the workflow and issue type scheme, besides any other configuration, from an existing project.
fields.summary: Bring "Classic Project" template back

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47171].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Empty fields are not displayed on Issue Screen.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make it possible to to display a field on the issue screen even if it is empty.

h3. Workaround 
Set a 'none' default option.
fields.summary: Display empty fields on Issue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47168].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
Add a gadget to show issues currently assigned to me
Assign n+1 entries to the current user where n := the number shown per page
View the NEXT TO LAST page of issues
In another tab, open/resolve one issue assigned to that user.
Click to view the next (last) page of issues assigned to that user.

(so if 10 issues per page, create 11, resolve one (in another tab), then try to view page 2 of data)

Result:
The gadget reports that 0 issues are assigned to the user.

Workaround:
The bug is just a temporary issue and reloading the page fixes it; not sure if the autoupdate would or not though.

Expected result (suggested):
View the first page of issues for that user

Since you are requesting page x+1 of x pages, the desired behavior is a little ambiguous but the most reasonable seems to be to just reload the first page of data for the gadget.
fields.summary: Assigned to me gadget reports 0 issues incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Strange and Confusing INFO messages about Custom Field contexts are thrown in JIRA logs, when you try to perform bulk change, if search filter is performed by specific project or issue type that a custom field's context is restricted to.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create any custom field with a restricted context e.g. to specific project or issue types
# Try to perform a bulk change with filter set to this specific project or issue type
# Select from Issue Navigator Tools menu > Bulk Change > Choose Issues: select all Issues > Next > choose operation: select 'Edit Issues' > Next
# No need to actually confirm the Bulk Change

h3. Expected Results
There should be no INFO about missing configuration in the logs

h3. Actual Results
INFO such as the following are thrown in JIRA logs, regarding custom fields that are restricted to the project or issue type in the search, right after selecting Edit Issues and clicking the next button.
{code}
2015-11-23 03:52:38,997 http-bio-8641-exec-6 INFO admin 232x1185x1 1cvxex3 127.0.0.1 /secure/views/bulkedit/BulkEditDetails.jspa [jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl] No relevant config found for Story Points for the issue null
2015-11-23 03:52:39,010 http-bio-8641-exec-6 INFO admin 232x1185x1 1cvxex3 127.0.0.1 /secure/views/bulkedit/BulkEditDetails.jspa [jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl] No relevant config found for myCustomfield for the issue null
{code}

h3. Notes
# This is more of an aesthetic bug actually - just a harmless INFO message, has no consequence whatsoever on the bulk change, which would still go on to execute successfully.
# Modifying custom field contexts to global causes this weird INFOs to disappear.
fields.summary: No relevant conf found for Custom Field for the issue null - INFO logged during bulk-change operation

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47058].
  {panel}

When upgrading JIRA, the pre-stage version will have new versions of the plugins, that are compatible with the upgraded version at some point - these can be copied across into the {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} directory of the production upgrade before it's started, so that the reindex doesn't have to happen twice.

This is important for larger instances as the indexing time can take a large time, so currently:

# You upgrade JIRA, then reindex.
# Install new plugins.
# Reindex again.

The change proposes:

# Upgrade JIRA.
# Copy across the upgraded plugins on pre-stage from {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} into the new version.
# Start JIRA, reindex, no need to reindex again.
fields.summary: Update our Upgrading JIRA with a Fallback Method documentation to include plugin changes for major versions

h3. Expected Behavior

h3. Actual Behavior
Date on Activity Stream for Spanish language is completely broken (see screenshot) for activities performed in any year other than the current.

!activitystream_spanish.png|thumbnail!

Weirdly, when you only have activities that are affected by this problem, refreshing the page resets the language for dates to the instance's default.

!activitystream_postrefresh.png|thumbnail!

If you have activities performed one day before or any date inside the current year along with broken ones, refreshing the page keeps the broken dates on headers for each day, but on detailed date for each activity, the format will still be reset to the instance's default.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the user's language preference to Spanish;
# Add an *Activity Stream* gadget to a Dashboard;

Currently, there's no workaround for this problem.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is currently no in built report or gadget in JIRA that allows a user to configure a report on how specific values of a field changes against time. e.g. a bar chart to see the trend of issues reported by a specified user or couple of users over the past few months; or trend of issues having a particular custom field value over time.

The closest to this currently available in JIRA is the pie-charts. However, this can only capture static of the current time.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide a configurable generic charting gadget that could be used to create reports on how a specific issue statistic changes over time JIRA.
* This gadget should also allow configurability of timeframe e.g. weekly, monthly etc
fields.summary: As a user I would like a configurable generic report of given Issue statistic against time

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a re-indexing node goes down (terminated abruptly or crashed), all the other nodes are not able to tell that re-indexing is no longer in progress. There is no impact for normal JIRA functionality. This is UI problem and you will be not able to run reindex.

(i) Please note that there is another similar problem related to project reindex, see JRASERVER-72055.

h3. Environment
 * JIRA Data Center
 * Apache Load Balancer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a Jira Data Center with atleast 2 nodes
 # Start re-indexing from one node
 # Access the re-indexing administration page from the other nodes to see the Re-indexing progress summary
 # Abruptly terminate the JIRA process on the re-indexing node
 # Access re-indexing administration again on the node that is still online

h3. Expected Results
This should show that the re-indexing process has been terminated, and should allow you to restart re-indexing if needed.

h3. Actual Results
The online node(s) are not able to detect that the re-indexing started in the other node has been terminated.
You will see the error in UI: '_Lock JIRA and rebuild index' option is unavailable while other indexing operations are in progress_.'
 !indexing_not_available.JPG|thumbnail! 

h5. Notes
* When user starts *FullReindexing* JIRA schedules the job at specific node and add _non-cancellable_ task into Global cache. This cache is synced with each node.
* When node dies, value still present in the cache and all nodes see it and believes that index is still running. 
* Whole cluster shutdown is needed to flush the cache
* Looking into the database from our test we can see that there is an entry in the {{replicatedindexoperation}} table such as the following for each re-index triggered:
{code:sql}
mysql> SELECT * FROM replicatedindexoperation;
+-------+---------------------+---------+----------------+-------------+--------------+--------------------------+-------------------------+
| ID    | INDEX_TIME          | NODE_ID | AFFECTED_INDEX | ENTITY_TYPE | AFFECTED_IDS | OPERATION                | FILENAME                |
+-------+---------------------+---------+----------------+-------------+--------------+--------------------------+-------------------------+
| 10500 | 2015-11-19 20:00:11 | tnode1  | ALL            | NONE        |              | FULL_REINDEX_START       |                         |
| 10501 | 2015-11-19 20:32:02 | tnode1  | ALL            | NONE        |              | FULL_REINDEX_END         | IndexSnapshot_10500.zip |
+-------+---------------------+---------+----------------+-------------+--------------+--------------------------+-------------------------+
4 rows in set (0.00 sec)
{code}
** There is another entry when this reindex ends. For the killed re-indexing node there is a start with no end entry.

h3. Problem mitigation 
To partially address the problem and mitigate some of the possible scenarios, we implemented 2 new features: 
* JRASERVER-68885 - Remove the stale indexing Job associated with the current node on startup
* JRASERVER-68616 - As an JIRA Datacenter Administrator I want to delete the reindexing task from offline node

Please check them for more details. 

h3. Workarounds
# Shut down all nodes in the cluster.
#* This is needed since JIRA keeps cluster reindex status in memory (see Notes section). Leaving one available and restarting all others will keep the in-memory cache.
# Start nodes
fields.summary: When a re-indexing node is abruptly stopped indexing still shows as in progress on other nodes, preventing future reindexing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The dashboard-owner are changing the default sort order of this gadget for everyone who uses the dashboard.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Do the same steps for JIRA 6.1.4 and JIRA 6.4.11 :

1. Login to JIRA as admin 
2. Add "Filter Results" gadget in dashboard
3. Choose one of the saved filter and Save.
4. Go to {{Issue > Search for Issue > Click on the Filter}} added in the step 2
5. Try change the Filter configuration by changing the order of the issue: Eg: _ORDER BY assignee ASC_
6. Save the filter
7. Click on the Dashboard , try to change the order by clicking on any of the header in the gadget .
8. Go to other pages and come back to Dashboard page again.
8. Check if the order of the "Filter Results" gadget is same with the one configured in the Filter in step 5.

*For version 6.1.4:*
The order of the item in the "Filter Results" gadget ordered based on the Saved Filter and the order is maintained even after tried to change the order , go to other pages , then come back to the Dashboard Page.This is the expected and default behaviour of the filter

*For version 6.4.11:*
The "Filter Results" gadget display the issue order based on the last action performed by the admin which is by clicking on the header of the gadget and is not following as configured in the Saved Filter.

h3. Expected Results
The order of the item in the "Filter Results" gadget should depend and show as in the order of the Saved Filter by the owner of the filter.

h3. Actual Results
When the owner of the shared-dashboard clicks on one of the column headings in the table, JIRA will re-sort the table by that column, and this will then become the default sort order of that dashboard. 
When a different user now loads that dashboard, it will be sorted by the column that the owner clicked on. In contrast, if a different user (not the owner) clicks on a column heading, the table will only be temporary re-sorted.
fields.summary: "Filter Results" gadget should display the issues as ordered in the Saved Filter by the owner of the filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Can not Update JIRA License as no option to add licence details is shown in the User Interface, when selecting "I have a key". 

Confirm New Installation, Your license Key has expired page does not work in Google Chrome. 

The {{ConfirmNewInstallationWithOldLicense!default.jspa}} page which is shown when upgrading a JIRA instance to JIRA 7.0.2 fails to display correctly in Google Chrome and instead reports some JavaScript Error. The options "I have a key", "Proceed under the Evaluation Terms", "Remove expired licenses" do not function when the radio buttons are selected. 

This an occur when you have an expired license, or when moving from Server to Data Center, if the license is not updated first.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.0.2 onwards. Still applicable in Jira 8.13.5.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. Expired license
# Restore an XML backup that contains an Expired JIRA Service Desk License. 
# Observe the License Warning
# Attempt to Update the JIRA License / Try to remove the expired license.

h4. Non DC license
# Set up a Server instance with a Server license
# Add a {{cluster.properties}} file to the local home directory (see [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/set-up-a-jira-data-center-cluster-993929600.html])
# Start Jira and you will see an error page stating 'JIRA is set up to run as a Data Center instance, but it doesn't have a valid Data Center license. Replace the current license here'
# Click on the 'current license here' link, which takes you to {{ConfirmNewInstallationWithOldLicense!default.jspa}}
# The page will display like this:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-01 at 12.29.33 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Look at the console and you will see a lot of {{ERR_HTTP2_PROTOCOL_ERROR}} errors on downloading the required JS and CSS:
 !console.png|thumbnail! 
# Enter credentials and a new license and click proceed - note that without the JS the button does nothing

h3. Expected Results
All Supported browsers should allow users to progress when loading the page to update the JIRA Licence Details with either the:
"I have a JIRA Key" or "Proceed under Evaluation Terms" options. 

When each of the Radio buttons are selected, form elements should load that allow the user to progress with the upgrade process.

h3. Actual Results
The options to update the licence on the page do not function, a JavaScript error is reported by Google Chrome and you can not progress on the form.

h3. Workaround 
Use a different browser such as Safari of Firefox to make the required updates to the license. Alternatively the license can be updated [directly in the database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/manage-jira-server-license-using-database-queries-441746313.html].
fields.summary: Problems displaying ConfirmNewInstallationWithOldLicense!default.jspa in Chrome

*Problem Definition*
Currently JIRA 7 will be using 
# Default Software Permission Scheme for Software project.
# Default Permission Scheme for Business project.
Even after all the software projects are associated to Default Permission Scheme and Default Software Permission Scheme is deleted, when user try to create a new Software project, it will recreate new Default Software Permission Scheme and use it.

*Suggested Solution*
Allow user to delete Default Software Permission Scheme permanently so when user create a new software project it will be using Default Permission Scheme.

*Workaround*
User will have to manually switch to Default Permission Scheme after the project creation.
fields.summary: Allow all Projects in JIRA 7 to use Default Permission Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Application access does not work with groups containing the "&", "#", "+", "*" or "^" character in the name
** Eg.  *FOO&BAR* breaks the application access page
* This also affects groups Synced from LDAP

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.0.0#70107
* JIRA 7.1.0
* JIRA 7.1.1
* LDAP


h3. Steps to Reproduce
*Without LDAP*
# Create a group with the either "&", "#", "+", "*" or "^" character on its name (e.g. JIRA-R&D)
# Go to *Admin > Applications > Application Access*
# Add the group *JIRA-R&D* to an Application
# The error will show up at the Application Access screen

(!) This will only happens it there is no group called *JIRA-R*

*With LDAP*
# Create a group in LDAP containing  '&' (ampersand) char
# Sync the directory
# Add the group to application access



h3. Expected Results
* The application should show the group added without any error

h3. Actual Results
# JIRA will keep showing the following error for the Application Access page:
!JIRA-R_does_not_exist.png|thumbnail!
# No exception is thrown in the logs

h3.Workaround
*Workaround 1*
# Switch to the Groups page <JIRA_URL>/secure/admin/user/GroupBrowser.jspa
# Add a group with the name reported in the error.
# Create a new group without the "&" character
# Go to *Admin > Applications > Application Access*
# Remove the old group entry
# Add the new created group

*Workaround 2*
1. Delete the group from LDAP and re-sync the user directories 
2. Delete the group from application access page rest api as described here :
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/applicationrole-put
{code}
{
    "key": "jira-software",
    "groups": [
        "jira-software-users",
        "jira-administrators"
    ]
}
{code}
fields.summary: Application access does not work with groups containing the "&", "#", "+", "*" or "^" character in the name

fields.description:
We are using Jira 6.4.5 with Crowd 2.8.3.

1)  When Crowd is offline any users who try to log in, their "Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed" count increases since Jira isn't able to authenticate the users.  This shouldn't be the case.  Users will keep trying to log in and eventually max out their attempts.  When Crowd is back online, we have their "Reset Failed Login Count" for them to be able to log in again.

2) https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-jira-options-185729544.html
"The maximum authentication attempts that are allowed before CAPTCHA is shown to a user. If you leave it blank then CAPTCHA will never be shown and users will have unlimited authentication attempts."

When we try to leave it blank, it defaults back to 3.
fields.summary: Jira Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46716].
  {panel}

If a workflow has a transition step "Post Function" that automatically assigns a ticket back to a previous person, like this one:

"Assign the issue to the last user from the Developers role who had this issue assigned before"

Then the post function does not "see" any users who have had their username changed. It skips them and moves on to the next user in the list of recently assigned users.

This is repeatable every time. Existing JIRA workflows for transitioning tickets and auto-assigning tickets based on that workflow is effectively broken and it assigns tickets to the wrong person. The most important part to this is that it does so silently. I was only able to figure out it was because of a changed username after a lot of debugging.

Example scenario:

1. Ticket is "In Progress" 
2. Developer transitions the ticket to "In Review" and assigns it to a reviewer
3. The reviewer has some issues with the ticket so they "Reject Review" and the transition post function is supposed to re-assign it back to the developer automatically

Expected Result:
The ticket is assigned to the previous assignee.

Actual Result (for those assignees with changed usernames):
The ticket is assigned to the person that was the assignee before the previous assignee, one person too far up the list.
fields.summary: User does not get assigned ticket during workflow transition if username has been changed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46618].
  {panel}

*Feature Summary*
If a user names a field say 'DA' and has lots of other fields that begin with other character but have DA in their name, they would not be able to select the field DA to add as a column in a filter.

This is due to the fact that when adding columns, JIRA sorts the fields in alphabetical order based on their names and should these issues be more than 50 your field DA which doesn't have a unique enough name would not be shown.

_Attached is an imge to explain the sorting and why it could be an issue._

*Suggestion*
Sort fields by those that match the name closest, hence the field DA would show up first before a field which contains characters that from the name.

*Workaround*
- Rename the field to a longer unique name
- Search for the new name when adding the column.
- Add the column.
- Rename the field back to old name if you want it.
_Note that the column would remain however you would need to repeat this each time you want to add the field as a column to other filters or search results._
fields.summary: Allow Column Search Start With Closest Match

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
* When re-ordering a sub-tasks one step up or down, this causes the full page to refresh. 
* This issue was not occurring in JIRA 6.4.5 , but it started occurring only after upgrading to JIRA 7. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7
# Create an issue
# Create many sub-task 
# Re-order the sub-task ( move the subtask up and down )
!rsz_screenshot_from_2015-11-16_171805.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
* The sub-task should be able to be moved without the whole page refreshing as it works well in JIRA 6.4.5

h3. Actual Results
* The whole page is refresh resulting in the user needing to scroll back to where they were before. It refreshes with every Move button push which makes re-organizing sub-tasks too cumbersome to ever do.
 
h3. Notes
* This issue is related to [JRA-33647 Allow reordering of sub-tasks with drag & drop and without having to reload the page|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-33647] but that ticket did not give enough information and has been closed as duplicate to [JRA-24547 Drag and Drop Subtasks|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24547] which i believe is entirely different to what is reported in this bug ticket as this issue was not occurring in older versions of JIRA. That ticket is also created as a suggestion and i believe this issue a bug.
fields.summary: Re-ordering (moving) a sub-task one step up or down causes a full page refresh

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you upload an image with the same name as the issue key, then JIRA allows you to upload this. However, when you want to insert the image somewhere in your comments, then we are not able to do so as when we type \!issuekey.png|thumbnail!, then the issue key turns to a hyperlink to the issue, instead of rendering the image.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the wiki renderer render the text in a image tag as an image and disregards any issue key links found. An alternative solution could be to have an escape character that will escape the issue key to be rendered as a hyperlink of that issue. 

h3. Workaround
This is no workaround for this. However, you may still link a image in the comment field using the following method: \[^Issue-Key.png].This would create a link that would open up when clicked on.
fields.summary: As a User, I want to images named as the issue key, to be rendered as images instead of a link to the issue, in the comments
"Create using shared configuration" should have an option to also clone HipChat integration settings

fields.summary: Jira shows blank page after Upgrade from 6.3.4 to 7.0.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46458].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The URL that is suggested for use in JIRA Data Center behind a load balancer, as mentioned in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ENTERPRISE/JIRA+Data+Center+Load+Balancer+examples states to use {{/status}} and it will return {{"state":"RUNNING"}} for a healthy node that should be in the LB pool.  In my testing, I found that when a node is performing a *foreground re-index* that locks JIRA, it is actually unavailable for processing user requests.  Accessing a node that is performing a locking re-index redirects to an error page and gives an HTTP 503.  When that is occurring, I would not want that node to have user requests routed to it. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Having multiple nodes for JIRA Data Center, we like foreground re-indexing as it is much faster with the amount of data we have.  So when a node is locked for re-indexing we'd like it to take itself out of the pool. This issue is to suggest either:
* the /status page be updated to provide a different status during indexing, possibly {{"state":"INDEXING"}}.  This would allow a LB health check to take the node out of the pool during indexing
* update the Data Center LB documentation (above) to instruct users to use {{/secure/errors.jsp}} as the health check URL as it more accurately conveys whether a node is capable of servicing requests
fields.summary: JIRA Data Center health check status URL doesn't accommodate for foreground indexing

fields.description:
Installing JIRA 7.0.0 64-bit linux installer on CentOS 7. The log shows a warning:
13-Nov-2015 17:53:52.563 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin [SetPropertiesRule]{Server/Service/Engine/Valve} Setting property 'resolveHosts' to 'false' did not find a matching property.

JIRA is shipped with Tomcat 8. Tomcat doesn't support the resolveHosts property anymore. This could be removed from the server.xml config file. 

Row in server.xml: <Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.AccessLogValve" resolveHosts="false"
fields.summary: Setting property 'resolveHosts' to 'false' did not find a matching property.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46388].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Right now, JIRA does not accept ";" to spread users and so, add several users at the same time on the Watchers field.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if JIRA accepted the ";" symbol to separate users and allow the additional of several users at the same time to the Watchers field.
fields.summary: Ability to add multiple users as watcher
